event.title: Founded as a rural village in 1838

data.event: Founded as a rural village in 1838 on the banks of the Sturt River, Marion was found to have rich soil and the population expanded rapidly.

event.title: was laid out by William Light and B. T. Finniss in 1838

data.event: The township of Marion was laid out by William Light and B. T. Finniss in 1838, and was (mis)named for Marianne Fisher (1827–1927), daughter of the Resident Commissioner, James Hurtle Fisher.
Richard Hamilton started the first vineyard in 1838 and his family continues its wine making tradition to this day.

event.title: continues its wine making tradition to this day

data.event: Richard Hamilton started the first vineyard in 1838 and his family continues its wine making tradition to this day.

event.title: crept up to Marion, and by the 1950s

data.event: However, the population at this time was still very small – around 350 people.Gradually the Adelaide sprawl crept up to Marion, and by the 1950s the suburb was well and truly enveloped.
